newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan farm body says to cut feed price for Oct-Dec.
newsitem.headline: Japan farm body says to cut feed price for Oct-Dec.

text.p: The National Federation of Agricultural Co-operative Associations said on Tuesday it would lower feed wholesale prices by about 1,100 yen a tonne for the October/December period from the previous July/September period.
The federation is Japan's largest feed producer with nearly 30 percent of the domestic market. Other feed makers are expected to follow the move, industry officials said.

The price cut was due to the falling Chicago corn market and the yen's stronger tone against the dollar since July, which helped push down grain purchasing costs for Japanese feed makers, the federation said in a statement.
The farm body reviews feed wholesale prices every quarter. The price for October-December was up by 11,000 yen from the year-ago level.
